general.title: Multispectral UAV Image calibration and alignment
general.author: Jurrian Doornbos
general.description: Python-based calibration procedures for DJI Mavic 3M, DJI Phantom 4 Multispectral, MicaSense Altum (-pt), RedEdge and Parrot Sequoia. This repository serves as a starting point to work with raw images from multispectral sensors.

preprocessing.description: The repository processes raw multispectral drone imagery by aligning different spectral bands and converting raw digital numbers to calibrated reflectance values.

analysis.algorithm: Feature-based image alignment with ORB and FLANN matching
analysis.description: The repository uses ORB feature detection and FLANN-based matching to align spectral bands. It also performs radiometric calibration through black level subtraction, exposure time normalization, gain correction, irradiance scaling, and sunshine sensor correction.

evaluation.description: This is a preprocessing pipeline rather than a predictive model, so traditional evaluation metrics are not applicable.
